paper_abstract: Let T(n) denote the set of unrooted labelled trees of size n and let M be a particular (finite, unlabelled) tree. Assuming that every tree of T(n) is equally likely, it is shown that the limiting distribution as n goes to infinity of the number of occurrences of M is asymptotically normal with mean value and variance asymptotically equivalent to mu n and sigma(2)n, respectively, where the constants mu > 0 and sigma >=, 0 are computable.
paper_title: The distribution of patterns in random trees
